  • Constructor Details

    • MacroStmt

    • MacroStmt

      public MacroStmt(ProofWorksheet w, String name, String args)
      Creates a MacroStmt using an input String.

      The input String is parsed into lines so that lineCnt can be incremented, and newline characters are re-inserted into the text.

      The macro text is prefixed by "$m " on the first output line and " " on subsequent lines.

      Parameters:
      w - the owner ProofWorksheet
      name - The macro name
      args - The string of macro arguments, with whitespace preserved

    • stmtIsIncomplete

      public boolean stmtIsIncomplete()
      Description copied from class: ProofWorkStmt
      Is statement incomplete?

      -- used primarily for cursor positioning:

      -- a virtual method that checks the statement for the state of "incompleteness" of data as indicated by state variables in the specific ProofWorkStmt types.

      Specified by:
      stmtIsIncomplete in class ProofWorkStmt
      Returns:
      true if ProofWorkStmt is "incomplete" in ProofWorksheet terminology.

    • load

      public String load(String firstToken) throws IOException, MMIOException, ProofAsstException
      Description copied from class: ProofWorkStmt
      Default load method for ProofWorkStmt that does not validate the input.

      This is used for GeneratedProofStmt and CommentStmt -- and any other possible future statement where you, theoretically, want to be able to parse and load the input statement but don't care about the contents.

      Output/Updates

      • accum tokens and whitespace into stmtText, but don't validate the contents, just look for the start of the next statement.
      • return nextToken after trailing whitespace, the start of the next statement.
      Overrides:
      load in class ProofWorkStmt
      Parameters:
      firstToken - the first token
      Returns:
      the nextToken
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error
      MMIOException - if an error occurred
      ProofAsstException - if an error occurred
